page.title: 04Rainhill's Recreation Club.
page.content: The Rainhill Recreation Club was founded about 30 years ago on its present site at the end of Tasker Terrace alongside the Liverpool to Manchester railway. It was originally founded as a summer recreation club with three tennis courts, a bowling green and a cricket square. The club houe was wooden and was little more than a store for equipent. This building caught fire and was burnt down about ten years ago and the insurance payments allowed a brick building with a bar, changing rooms and showers to be built. Winter sports have been introduced with the creation of football and a rugby team.
